official_name: West Bengal Minority Development & Finance Corporation (WBMDFC) Scholarship
target_group: Minority Community Students of West Bengal
academic_level: Professional & Technical Courses (Engineering, Medical, Law, etc.)
introduction: Aikyashree Scholarship is a flagship scholarship scheme of the Government of West Bengal aimed at providing financial assistance to students belonging to minority communities. The scheme ensures that economically weaker minority students can continue their education without financial burden.

fresh_application.title: Fresh Application
fresh_application.who_should_apply: Students applying for the Aikyashree Scholarship for the first time in the current academic year

renewal_application.title: Renewal Application
renewal_application.who_should_apply: Students who received the scholarship in the previous year and are continuing their studies

basic_requirements: Applicant must be a permanent resident of West Bengal
Applicant must belong to an officially notified minority community
Applicant must be studying in a recognized institution
Distance education courses are not eligible

academic_requirements.fresh: Must have passed the last qualifying examination (Class 12 or equivalent) with minimum 55%–60% marks (varies by course)
academic_requirements.renewal: Must be promoted to the next year/semester with satisfactory academic performance (generally around 60%)

income_criteria.issued_by: BDO / SDO or any competent government authority

scholarship_benefits.description: Financial assistance is provided directly to the student's bank account through DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer).

fresh_application: Marksheet of last examination passed (Class 12 / previous qualifying exam)
Institute Verification Form (signed by Head of Institution)
renewal_application: Latest Marksheets of previous year/semester (all cleared)

steps: Login and fill the application form

renewal_rules: Do not register as fresh if already applied earlier
Income and minority status must remain valid
important_notes: Aadhaar-linked bank account ensures faster payment
False information may lead to rejection
Only one scholarship can be availed at a time for the same course

faq.question: Who can apply for Aikyashree Scholarship?
faq.answer: Students from minority communities who are residents of West Bengal and meet income & academic criteria.

faq.question: Can distance education students apply?
faq.answer: No, distance education courses are not eligible.

faq.question: Is Aadhaar mandatory?
faq.answer: Yes, Aadhaar is required for faster DBT credit.

official_authority.department: West Bengal Minority Development & Finance Corporation (WBMDFC)
